transcript.title: MEMBERSHIP OF THE OFFICIAL ESTABLISHMENTS TRUST
transcript.content:
V
FOR7MEDIA WEDNESDAY, 4 NOVEMBER 1981
MEMBERSHIP OF THE OFFICIAL ESTABLISHMENTS TRUST
I am pleased to announce the appointment of Mr J G ( Jock)
Gosse and Mrs Frank Crean as members of the Official
Establishments Trust.
The terms of appointment of two of the inaugural members of
the Trust, the Hon James Cope, CMG, and Dame Helen Blaxland, DBE,
were completed last month.
Both made valuable contributions to the work of the Trust
during the initial period of its operations.
The five member Trust is chaired by Sir Andrew Grimwade, CBE.
The other members are Mr Guilford Bell and Mrs H B Gullet.
The Trust was established by the Government in September 1979
to advise on the conservation, development and efficient
operation of the buildings and grounds of Government House
and the The Lodge, Canberra, and Admiralty House and
Kirribilli House, Sydney.
The Government is pleased that Mr Gosse and Mrs Crean have agreed
to serve on the Trust. Both are also members of'the
Australiana Fund which is developing a collection of fine art
and furnishings for display in the four official residences.
